thread.title: Topless women of Times Square say they can't be restricted
thread.title_full: Topless women of Times Square say they can't be restricted

title: Topless women of Times Square say they can't be restricted
text:
Topless women of Times Square say they can't be restricted Tools 
Story Created: Oct 11, 2015 at 1:00 PM   11, 2015 at 2:00 PM EDT 
NEW YORK (AP) â€” Facing a cringe-worthy crisis after decades of polishing up Times Square's image, some city officials are proposing roped-off areas for the painted ladies and costumed characters who seek tips to pose for tourist photos. 
But several of the topless, body-painted women who spoke candidly with The Associated Press this past week made it clear that, restrictions or not, they're not going anywhere. 
Twenty-nine-year-old Saira Nicole says she'd defy any move to restrict the women to a specific zone. As she put it, "You're not putting a stop to me, period." 
But City Councilman Corey Johnson says the city must ease pedestrian crowding by setting some restrictions. He's a member of a hastily convened city task force that has proposed the "activity zones."
